author: Margaret Minnicks
title: Whoopi Goldberg's tour bus burst into flames while she was performing in Canada
text:
Whoopi Goldberg Photo by Monica Schipper/Getty Images for NYCWFF Whoopi Goldberg doesn't fly. Therefore, she takes her tour bus on the road whenever she is performing. According to TMZ , Whoopi Goldberg's tour bus burst into flames behind an auditorium Saturday night and hundreds of people had to be evacuated from the casino in New Brunswick, Canada where the comedienne was performing. Witnesses say the show was stopped abruptly, and everyone in attendance was told to leave the building immediately. It's not unclear what started the blaze, but the fire is being investigated.
Gossip Cop confirms the fire that took place outside the Casino New Brunswick in Moncton, Canada. Fortunately, Whoopi who was performing onstage at the time and was not in any harm at the time of the bus fire. Members of the audience began smelling smoke, and shortly thereafter they were instructed to evacuate. Hundreds of fans, who were at Goldberg’s one-night only show, headed for the exit in an orderly manner. The Royal Canadian Mounted Police said no one was inside the bus when it began with an engine fire. The fire was put out very quickly. Neither the casino nor any fans were injured.
Even though people had to be evacuated from the casino, Whoopi Goldberg was near the end of her show when the bus fire was discovered. So far, the comedian and co-host of “The View” hasn't mentioned the incident on her Facebook or Twitter accounts. However, TMZ posted a photo of the tour bus in flames on Whoopi's Twitter page. Fortunately, no one was hurt in the accident that could have been much worse than it was.
